climbs.name: JugOrNot?
climbs.fa: Liam Hendricks, Nick Layton, Whitney Cammack, M.Rosenberg

content.description: start low beneath obvious white jugs, climb straight up 3 cruiser bolts, crux is getting the fourth bolt... a roof finish variation may happen soon. Currently there is no variation, the route goes at 10+R due to the nature of the finish. after pulling right past the fourth bolth there are a few heady/ runout moves to the anchor, that area needs cleaning... I would not want to fall after that fourth bolt... a fifth may appear this spring.
content.protection: four bolts to two bolt anchor
content.location: this is this the west most bolted route on the wall... for now

content.description: This route Climbs straight up and out the chimney, connects with DonoMight. This is a great warm up for the area, the moves flow so well and the finish is stellar and exposed feeling ( some may consider it slightly harder than 9+ until they find the right holds)
content.protection: 4 bolts to a two bolt anchor

content.description: start just right of the nice ledge. manage that first move and go up and left for four bolts and straight up to the fifth over the roof and boom!... note this may be the most striking natural line on the face... crux is low
content.location: to the right of the chimney... look for the hard looking route

content.description: This is the most obvious crack on the wall between donomight and jugornot. it traverses diagonally up and left toward the same finish as donomight and joint effort. watch out for bat shit! they were there first so please, let sleeping guano lie.
content.protection: small to medium cams, possible double #1 +#2 its a long hike to haul gear up, but if you happen to have the cams on you. two bolt anchor
content.location: start between donomight and jugornot in the black crack, fire through awesome jams to the wide section ( kind of flaring made more awkward by the guano) the route follows a diagonal crack to the top
